website_summaries.verdict: If a long lens, AA batteries, and some creative control over your photos are what you're after, the Canon PowerShot SX150 IS is a good choice. That is, as long as you don't mind it being painfully slow.
pros: The Canon PowerShot SX150 IS offers very good photo quality and features for its class, including semimanual and manual shooting modes, and it uses AA-size batteries
cons: The SX150 IS' shooting performance is miserable, as is its battery life, especially using alkaline batteries

customer_reviews.title: This camera has exceeded the capabilities that I purchased the ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera has exceeded the capabilities that I purchased the camera for. I not only use it to take pictures of cars at car shows, etc, but I'm also a volunteer with the Audubon Society where I observe my Eagle's nest during the season and have been able to take pictures of the Eagles near the nest which has to be a distance of at least half a block away up in the branches of a tall oak. This has a 12 zoom and the pictures have come out clear enough to have them framed and hung at our home.
customer_reviews.author: Jude Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Bad deal
customer_reviews.text: I have to try several times before it will take a picture! It shows the batteries are dead seconds after I put in new ones. Once it takes a picture, it's fine, but it's very frustrating to try to take pictures with it. It was a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Burt Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: WOW TALK ABOUT SUCKING THE LIFE OUT TO A BATTERY!
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great pictures I like it but it goes through batteries FAST! I have spent more on batteries since I bought it then I did the camera easily. Also the flash takes a long time to charge up so it is easy to miss the perfect shot. However you know when it is on because you have to manually flip it up, making it easier to not accidently take pictures of gallery subject matter that restricts the use of a flash. I think I will figure out the features eventually as with all electronics instructions leave unanswered questions.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Oravez

customer_reviews.title: A point and shoot with a big camera feel
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Still small enough for a pocket or purse but looks like a bigger camera with the lens extended. Very good photo quality compared to other instant "point and shoot" digital "small" cameras. Uses cheep SD cards instead of some expensive variation. Creates good photos inside and out with very little in the way of training or camera savvy knowledge. Competitive price Con: Slow to charge Flash, est. 15 sec. after I flipped up the flash hood. I understand that it may be under powered and eat up AA batteries. But they are cheep. Used it for over an hour on the weekend. Still same batteries so far but based on the flash I would guess they won't last.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Shiverdecker

customer_reviews.title: canon powershot sx150
customer_reviews.text: i have already tried the unit but not as much as to provide a more substantial feedback. i took quite a number of shots though, just for purposes of testing and so far i found it meeting my expectations i.e. easy to operate, handy, quick to synch to my laptop and its features like zooming, display, manipulating from auto, portrait etc. are quite nice. one thing i like as a hobbyist is the fact that i do not have to worry about charging the battery when traveling since i can easily buy alkaline battery anywhere. and that suits my purpose. i will get back when i have fully exhausted its capability :)
customer_reviews.author: JOHN B

customer_reviews.title: Got this as a replacement for identical camera I stupidly ran over
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for an identical camera that I stupidly put on the hood of my van when I was loading it, forgot about it, and ended up running over it. Yes, I am an idiot. Fortunately the memory card containing thousands of pictures was not damaged. I was very relieved to find the same camera on Amazon because I like everything about this model. It also takes surprisingly good pictures for what it is. It was delivered quickly and I will make sure never to put it on the hood of my car in the future.
customer_reviews.author: HistoryBuff

customer_reviews.title: This camera eats batteries for lunch
customer_reviews.text: It actually takes great pictures weather it be in full sun or low light conditions and I love the zoom feature. With the flash on it takes about 6-8 seconds between shots which I find very slow and it really drains the batteries after roughly 30 pics taken, even with lithium batteries.This was a replacement of my Canon Powershot A610 that finally died after 7 yrs which held 4 AA batteries, this camera only holds 2 AA's. If you plan to get this camera pack lots of AA batteries. I plan to keep the camera although I'm not happy with its performance when taking multiple shots with the flash on and supplement it with a better performing model.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera about 2 years ago and found it to be a great camera, but after 2 years it started going downhill. The auto-focus is going out and it is starting to eat up batteries like never before. I am sorry to see it go, as it took great pics and videos. I used it for everything and used my regular video camera as backup only. Guess it just got old. It was great while it lasted. Now, I'm shopping for a newer model Canon. So, if you want a really good, affordable camera for about 2 years, this is your camera.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera for about 6 months and I love it! For the price, it cannot be beat! It has so many features for taking pictures and the quality is great! It also takes excellent HD video and the audio quality is awesome for a camera like this! I've used it for several things since I bought it and it's basically paid itself off. Battery life for a point and shoot is probably average. The more you use it in one setting the quicker the batteries wear out. I turn it off when I can between pictures. I also switched to rechargeable batteries and they seem to last a little longer than traditional batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer by any means but this camera rocks! I took it to the Capitol One Citrus Bowl in Orlando and from about 30 rows up I got close-ups of the game that I made 8x12's of for my office. They look incredible. The camera is simple to master and affordable. I bought one for my Dad to finally get him to join the digital revolution and after his initial fear of new things subsided he fell in love with it. For the price you cannot find a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera! 100% recommendable!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great camera! It takes good pictures with little effort and it's so resistant! It has survived several falls (thanks to some careless friends) with almost no damage. It also looks like a good camera. It's kind of bigger than the average (which is great for me: it isn't too toyish/small, and yet it fits in my pocket), so some people have even gotten confused and asked me if it was a semi-professional. It has worked greatly for the last two years. I recommend using the Eneloop Ni-MH batteries with it (otherwise battery life will be a deal breaker)!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina B.

customer_reviews.title: Good camera with enthusiast controls
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a loaner for my students to borrow. For the college photography classes I teach, the students must use a camera with shutter priority, aperture priority, and manual modes. This is the least expensive camera I have found which has those modes available. It is also an excellent little camera, and takes very nice photos. Sure, a nice DSLR is better, but if this is your price point, I would recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera for my hobbies
customer_reviews.text: I normally like to use electronics a bit before leaving a review but I've been getting emails so... Nice pictures, easy to figure out. Overall I like it. Maybe a bit much in the price compared to features but the zoom on this thing is incredible. I'd have a more indepth review later but 4 out of 5 becuase it's a bit pricey. Not a bad little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amber C

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a camera that was a step beyond the point and shoot with a great zoom. I have liked and had good succes with Canon in the past and was hoping to step up without all the way up and without relearning a new camera. This camera definitely fits the bill. I love the zoom as it refocuses great during zoom and the picture quality has been very solid. Only drawback is having to remember to lift the flash but that, I can live with. It's a bit hard on batteries too but with rechargeable that's a non-issue. Overall I think it's a really great camera from a great camera company for the money!
customer_reviews.author: MonsonMommyTo2

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. I hated taking pictures with my cell phone and this is the perfect alternative for me. Easy point and shoot. Great pictures. I have not gone to the reusable batteries yet as I have not really gone through batteries as quick as I thought I would. The flash is perfect for getting just the right amount of light for inside pictures. I'm really very happy with this camera. Not too big and not too small either.
customer_reviews.author: DianaK

customer_reviews.title: Camera Was In "Like New" Condition
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this used camera to replace the same model I had used for over 10 years. I had dropped the old one a number of times over the years but the most recent fall rendered it unrepairable. This used camera is in like new condition. Excellent product and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera a lot especially since I don't have a nice phone to take pictures with. The picture quality looks awful when you take the picture but then when you go back and look at it, it looks really nice. It came with the cable to upload the pictures and an SD card but I replaced it with one that had more memory.It also came with CDs that I haven't bothered with. The only downfall is that it does require batteries and they die SO fast.Overall, I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased four of these for the high school photo classes I teach. They replaced a 6-year old model that we have as they slowly die out. This camera is great if you know what you are doing (manual setting allows you to control ISO, aperture - albeit aperture choice is very limited - and shutter speed) or if you don't and want a camera that will do the thinking for you. Great photos every time and the kids had no problem figuring them out.
customer_reviews.author: Highwayflower

customer_reviews.title: This camera takes awesome pictures, BUT
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes awesome pictures, BUT... The battery pack does not stay charged long, and it only takes one kind that I can find and they are cheap cheap cheap quality! This would turn me off from ever buying this camera or suggesting for other to buy it. If anyone has any suggestions to other fitting battery packs, I'll take them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Thompson

customer_reviews.title: great camera.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I wanted one that took great pictures and video. It does not disappoint. I still haven't learned everything this camera can do but I've taken some great pictures and videos at concerts and events. HD video is clear and playback is easy. Easy to upload pictures to my computer too. I've blown up some of my pictures and the quality is amazing. Love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Saporito

customer_reviews.title: No battery life! Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Takes good pictures but drains the batteries in about an hour. I bought 2 of these, unfortunately, the battery issue applies to both. Even using ultra batteries doesn't help!
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Never used. Too difficult to use. Confusing icons.
customer_reviews.text: 10/10/2018 Update. Have never used this camera. difficult to use. Can easily point and shoot my phone and get terrific photos. Don't need a hard to use camera with yet another app to load. Original Review: I'm finding this a little difficult to use due to unclear icons. Tempts me to use phone camera instead.
customer_reviews.author: Auteur

customer_reviews.title: drains the batteries within minutes
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older version Canon powerShot with this one thinking they would be the same, but this one is a battery eater. I put in fresh batteries and within 30 min they need to be replaced. other than that it's a good camera that is easy to use and produces good quality images.
customer_reviews.author: westshop

customer_reviews.title: Okay, horrible battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this camera, I just needed something with great picture quality for personal family shots. Picture quality is great, even in "auto" for less experience photographers. The camera offers fun and quirky modes that are fun as well., sadly all features are cut short by the ridiculously short battery life. Having other battery operated cameras, I expected a longer battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, slow flash
customer_reviews.text: This camera can be a good starting point for someone who wants to explore photography. Pros: 1) Lots of manual features 2) Very decent optics (for the price paid of course) 3) AA batteries, so that you never run out of power Cons: 1) It is not a camera to use in low light conditions. It's just not, as the flash recharges within 10 seconds! 2) 100 shots per set of batteries. Spare batteries should be always handy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended, mainly batterias problem with that did not last long, I've tried all kinds of rechargeable batteries including mhs 2800, in a few photos are depleted energy and delay in loading the flash. I have read of other users with the same problem and found no solution. I think Amazon know this and so sold them cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge C. Morales

customer_reviews.title: my review
customer_reviews.text: Good camera if you want a heavy, solid built camera. Could not get software to run on my new computer however. It ran fine on XP but did not work with 10 64 bit Don't know why.
customer_reviews.author: Domestic

customer_reviews.title: the Aperture/Shutter live feature is awesome for any first-time digital photographer looking into becoming a ...
customer_reviews.text: Other than pictures not feeling very High Quality and mostly noisy, the Aperture/Shutter live feature is awesome for any first-time digital photographer looking into becoming a professional. The battery life is pretty low. But I would recommend this product to people who are learning the correlation between ISO, aperture, and shutter speed.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi M

customer_reviews.title: Not good for close-ups
customer_reviews.text: I really needed a camera that could take clear pictures of close-up objects (macro focus). For some reason I thought this camera could do that. Boy was I wrong. Nothing is in focus if it's closer than 6 feet. And it eats batteries just like the other reviewers have mentioned. However, it does a good job of taking scenic photos and the optical zoom works well.
customer_reviews.author: Roy the reader

customer_reviews.title: A good quality camera for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: First, I am a Canon product lover, having owned numerous electronics of their brand. This camera was purchased to replace another and I investigated several well known brands before purchasing. I was totally impressed with the features and even made a trip to a local discount store to look at it first hand. It is simple to operate and takes clear and sharp photo's in almost any setting. It took a while to remember to manually pop up the flash attachment but that is the only down side I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: vagabohn

customer_reviews.title: Smart little camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little camera. Does more than I actually need, but that's not a bad thing. Compact, lightweight. Many photo taking options. Can be as simple point & shoot (camera does everything else for you) or fully manual and you set up everything the way you want for each shot. Would like an auto pop-up flash. Burns through standard batteries really fast. Use rechargeable!
customer_reviews.author: Kerry S.

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera, not the case !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Power Shot a couple of years ago, love it, easy to use, very clear pictures. Not too large to carry for long periods of time. My brother in law liked it so well, we ordered one for him. The camera case that is recommended with this camera DOES NOT FIT, don't order unless Amazon has made changes to sight and states that. Camera is great !!
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for myself! Wanted a good camera for so long and tired of buying cheesy ones that just got me through. so I broke down and bought a good one! I AM LOVING THIS CAMERA! Beautiful pictures, lots of options, great videos! You wont be disappointed! I have 9 grandkids so I needed a special camera for special moments!
customer_reviews.author: Shari K.

customer_reviews.title: Power hungry terrible flash camera
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is the worst camera I have ever had. This camera has many problems I will just list a few bad ones. 1) power hungry, 2) even with expensive lithium batteries the flash is very slow to charge, 3) The flash is not automatic you must pop it up 4) very hard to get a good picture inside. I recommend you stay away from this poorly designed camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: CANON POWER SHOT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the camera because my Kodak doesn't take very good indoor pictures. Even with a flash from 15' away the pictures are dark. This camera DOES take a pretty good picture even from far across a room with a flash, much better than the Kodak does, but pictures are not really QUITE as bright as I'd like them to be. For what the camera cost, though, it's easy to use and the pictures are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved this camera so much I replaced my old one........same camera....with this one. It's the best.
customer_reviews.author: S. Olson

customer_reviews.title: there  seems to be a discrepancy  in  focal  length
customer_reviews.text: This is from the user manual: The focal lengths for using the optical zoom and digital zoom are as follows (all focal lengths are 35mm equivalent) 28 - 1344mm (28 - 336mm when using Optical Zoom alone) Great camera!
customer_reviews.author: pete26

customer_reviews.title: Some issues
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for two months, now occasionally when I push the ON button, the LCD screen won't light with the scene and/or I get an error message to change the batteries (even after I put in fresh batteries). It hasn't completely failed yet and it's still under warranty, but I expect it to go in for repair when I need it most......say around Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: onthebay

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Very advanced features but, still very easy to use. You cannot take a bad picture. Images are very impressive. Took it on vacation and the camera amazed me more each time I used it. People thought I used a higher end camera. Works well in low light were most cameras would need flash .
customer_reviews.author: Glenn D. Durst

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures and video, eats batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Very good pictures and video, this is the one I use when I want to get really good video. Don't use it often because of the cons. Eats batteries very quickly, a bit more bulky than I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: splashy

customer_reviews.title: Dropped it!  Still works!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera to take photos of flowering plants, including close-ups of flowers. The close-ups come out wonderfully. Today, as I was trying to get a photo, I dropped the camera down a steep hillside. It bounced off at least 5 pretty big rocks on the way down. I had to find a way down to retrieve it. It is unharmed, and still works. Love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: MaryB.

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: We had one like this for two years and loved it. Someone took it while we were at Disney World on our last day. Certainly didn't mind replacing the camera. Just missed our pictures from 4 weeks of vacation. LOVE the fact that you can use regular batteries. Sometimes (like at Philmont) you can't charge anything. You can always AA get batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Evc

customer_reviews.title: Cool Little camera
customer_reviews.text: I have the caon 7d and was looking for something that I could just shove in my pocket or purse. It's a little big for my pocket, but great for the purse. The in camera setting are pretty cool and the size is just about right. The only problem that I have had with the camera is that the flash takes up to 60 seconds to charge before firing. It's a great camera when I don't want to carry all of my gear.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2_4

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures from this camera.
customer_reviews.text: Camera is easy to use and takes great pictures. Neither my wife nor I are photographers, but we are both complimented continuously for our great pictures. We take our own pictures of the kids and for Christmas cards and the pictures always look great. We want to buy another Canon like this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Heffington

customer_reviews.title: SX150is - Nice Camera - I Like It
customer_reviews.text: Very nice budget camera... excellent zoom capability, great pics and movies with the zoom, very good outside, not as good a performer inside without flash or outside in dim light... overall I like it but it is slightly larger to carry and handle than most current compacts... the best part is the AA battery operation.. terrific with Panasonic 2300 Enelopp rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: LP's

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the handiest little camera I've ever owned, and the photos are fabulous in terms of light, color, etc. I travel internationally a lot, and being able to use AA batteries to power the camera is so much easier and convenient than having to hunt for electricity that matches a plug-in. Fits in my belly bag and a big pocket...get one! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Bummer about the Batteries...
customer_reviews.text: I love Canon, but this camera was a bummer! I returned it because the batteries would die so fast that I couldn't even get to know the camera. It was a good price, but not worth all the dying batteries. Camera did have some nice features, but the manual flip up flash was strange also. I didn't like that! Don't waste your time on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The PowerShot
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera for it is not hard to operate and is not heavy in the hand. I have had ones in the past, that were heavy and made me shake at times. Plus the digital is very nice for you can see what you got and if not right can take another while you are there at the place you are wanting a good pic of. Plus it is very simple to operate and easy to understand. Thanks to Canom
customer_reviews.author: grdngrower

customer_reviews.title: GREAT pictures.. short battery life...
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this camera is great EXCEPT, as other reviewers have pointed out, short battery life.. however the pictures "POP" .. really good quality, just keep plenty of extra batteries with you...
customer_reviews.author: MuddeeWaters

customer_reviews.title: Great for road trips
customer_reviews.text: Last generation of Powershot to use AA batteries, and not wifi capable. This is what I was looking for. Great for road trips. You can easily find AA batteries, and SD cards, even outside the country. (Unlike the cannon proprietary battery pack.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Canon Quality
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this camera and myself for waiting too long to return it. The image stabilization doesn't work anywhere near as well as my older Canon 720IS. It's also a hassle to remember to lift the flash then you have to wait for it to charge. Tonight I took some photos then realized it set itself down to 640x480 size.
customer_reviews.author: sam-i-am

customer_reviews.title: Over-all a Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera...love it. The only downside is that it does have a high AA battery usage. I like the convenience of being able to use AA batteries, but I always have a couple in my pocket or pack because it always seems to need fresh batteries when I most want to get some photos. Otherwise, it is a solid camera for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Horsedogcat

customer_reviews.title: Omg, this camera is incredible!!! Canon is amazing as it has always been!!!
customer_reviews.text: So this thing takes better pictures than I could have ever imagined! I went outside and took close up pictures of a buttercup flower and that night I went and took a close up of the moon. Both turned out clear and perfect! WOW!!! love lovelovethis camera, my dad just got one too after seeing mine and he used to be a photographer. :)
customer_reviews.author: J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is an older model but takes fine pictures. It has enough modes that anyone should be able to find a way to take pictures their way. 12x zoom should be enough for most close ups. AA batteries means power is always close by. A winner of a camera especially if you can get a good price like I did.
customer_reviews.author: KSArnold

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera.. not the batteries
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it as a gift for my brother. He has not received it yet, but I already tried it when I received it to make sure it is not defected. I like it, I always owned Canon digital cameras, they are the best. I just wished that the batteries are not AA, i like those you can charge.
customer_reviews.author: Malik

customer_reviews.title: What a nice friendly camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because we do dog rescue and I needed a camera that had more speed than my previous digital camera but was simple enough for an idiot to use. I have not ventured into any of the bells & whistles yet, but the camera has taken some superb photos even on the auto-setting, and it has certainly helped place some dogs into new homes.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra Collins

customer_reviews.title: Decent camera
customer_reviews.text: It takes pretty good pictures, but the flash is really slow to charge, and I've missed lots of great kid shots because I was waiting for it to charge between flashes. Also, this thing eats batteries like nothing I've ever owned--you only get about 30-40 shots and the low battery light comes on (it's...crazy fast).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful photos from a camera that fits yout pocket.
customer_reviews.text: Took this camera to Hawaii last year. Got some good quality rechargable batteries and shot all day long. Our friends kept asking what kind of camera we had because the images were so sharp. The 12X zoom worked beautifully and the image stabilization made up for the lack of tripod in most cases. I was so pleased that I picked up another for the metallurgical lab at work. Great macro images as well.
customer_reviews.author: Terry B

customer_reviews.title: Bad Power
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to replace the Olympus Stylus that I had previously purchased. But just like the Olympus it uses up battery power to quickly. So you have to make sure you have extra batteries close to hand. The picture quality is great. Battery life crap.
customer_reviews.author: Ladysas

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera.
customer_reviews.text: It was a great camera but much bigger than I wanted. I carried it for a few days but could never find a good place to put it because of the size. The pictures were clear and color was excellent. Alas, I returned it for the Canon Elph.
customer_reviews.author: Lelovopo

customer_reviews.title: Canon SX 150 reject.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace the canon SX130 which got stolen and I loved. This models performance was subpar. Did not perform at all as a new and improved model. Ended up selling this one. I repurchased a refurbished SX130 of which I still own and use daily.
customer_reviews.author: goatbear2

customer_reviews.title: Best Point And Shoot
customer_reviews.text: This is the best point and shoot camera that I have ever owned. The new ones from Canon cannot compete with their lack of features. The lens is very sharp for this type of camera.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: My husband couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Valentine's Day gift for my husband. He's delighted with the camera. It has features that allow both "out of the box" usage and flexibility for more experienced / adventurous photographers. It's got big capabilities in a small, easy to bring along package.
customer_reviews.author: Denise R. Holliday

customer_reviews.title: It takes great pictures
customer_reviews.text: My previous camera just wore out from the use, and eventually the lens would not extend to take pictures. I was delighted to find this newer model of the one I'd been using. It has slightly improved features (more zoom capability and higher megapixel count). It feels lighter than my previous camera, but still takes the same great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Merry Homm

customer_reviews.title: but a good knockabout camera
customer_reviews.text: Nifty little camera that performs as advertised. Drops right in my shirt pocket. Not high end by any means, but a good knockabout camera.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Camera for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for Christmas, and it works very well. I use rechargeable Powerex Imedion Batteries, they have 2400 mAH capacity & have a extended shelf life. The Powerex Imedion batteries seem to work better then the Alkaline batteries they gave with the camera. You can purchase the batteries on Amazon. I would recommend getting the Powerex charger with the batteries for this camera. Over all I would highly recommend this camera it can take very nice pictures even in low light rooms.
customer_reviews.author: CJon

customer_reviews.title: Beware battery life
customer_reviews.text: The camera performs competently for its price point. The biggest drawback that I see is the battery life: if you put this in video mode and record around 5 minutes, you will have to replace the batteries. What's good is that it takes standard sized AA batteries. But it only holds 2 batteries. Why not make the case slightly larger and hold 4 batteries?
customer_reviews.author: William Markey

customer_reviews.title: A good camera that uses normal batteries !
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's best feature is I will not go broke buying expensive batteries for it. I carry a couple sets of high capacity AA rechargeable "eneloop's" when on vacation and it works out great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershoot SX150 IS
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research before purchasing this camera and two of the downsides about it was that it goes through batteries quickly and that it takes a while to recharge after taking a picture with a flash. But I decided to buy it anyway because it had all the other qualities I was looking for in a digital camera. And after playing around with it and testing it, the reviews were right on. But other than that, I love the camera and am enjoying the quality of pictures it does produce.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Excellent point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: The Canon SX-150 is everything advertised. The optical zoom is clear and responsive. I enjoy the shape of the camera as it is easier for me to hold than the very slim ELF series. The main feature I like is the use of AA batteries. I spend a lot of time in the wilderness with no access to a charging device. So the ability to use off the shelf batteries that I can carry with me is a necessity. Managing the size of each photo also allows me to select photos that I want to use in e-mail.
customer_reviews.author: jagertom

customer_reviews.title: They work great for what we need
customer_reviews.text: We use these cameras for processing pictures for our online business. They work great for what we need!
customer_reviews.author: B&K

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Tried and true like its older brother the 130 this works great. I like the dual AA battery design for long case work and lack of charging ability.
customer_reviews.author: Tacoma

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought as Christmas gift last year(2011) for our son. He uses it all the time. Taking pictures of everything he likes from cars to buildings, farm equipment, anything everything. Takes good pictures and would recommend for any novice. Wish it was rechargable.
customer_reviews.author: CJG

customer_reviews.title: very awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: this camera is very responsive and takes good pictures of moving things too without blurring. The zoom is also quite good and does not look blurry either and it has an easy setting for beginners wich is nice too. I have been obessing over this camera for nearly a year and read lots of reveiws, I'm so glad that I waited to get this camera it was worth it
customer_reviews.author: daisy2012

customer_reviews.title: You're getting an awful lot of camera for incredible price
customer_reviews.text: -Inexpensive -Sharp pictures -Great colours You're getting an awful lot of camera for incredible price, not only in terms of physical size, but features too. Negative Point: When the batteries are discharged, capturing photos can become sluggish
customer_reviews.author: Dayro Longas

customer_reviews.title: Canon Complacent With Useless Camera
customer_reviews.text: Canon service was about as rude as possible when this camera was received Dead Out Of The Box. They said it must have been dropped. Odd, the package in and out was perfect. Great delivery speed in time for my vacation next week, but now screwed. Thanks Canon for nothing. Amazon Customer Service was exceptional and I hope to have this camera sent back after my vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Colby E. Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: OK basic camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought one a couple years ago it was great. Bought a second recently and it is not near the same. Still ok but not great.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Good for casual users
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 17 year old daughter for Christmas. She loves everything about it except battery life - it goes through AA's like crazy. I bought a similar Canon model for my older daughter a year ago and she is also happy. As a fairly advanced photographer, I consider this a good choice for people wanting a bit more than simple point & shoot functionality, but who don't need professional caliber gear. Canon is always a good choice (Nikon too, which I use).
customer_reviews.author: Barrry Catlett

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed using this camera all the reviews on it are ...
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed using this camera all the reviews on it are correct it is a good camera the only con is the battery life but for my use that is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this camera, but would have liked it more if it didn't take AA batteries. I have found these batteries don't last too long. The overall camera it's self is great, I've always been rather fond of Canon Product. The quality of picture is great! Anyone that enjoys taking pictures and wants quality pictures, I would recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: george potter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: One of the best cameras made. I only buy cannon cameras. Always takes a perfect picture...easy to use and loaded with nice features. If you want a great picture and don't want a complicated machine...get this.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: camera review
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use the camera on a recent vacation. I found it extremely easy to use. I still have more to learn about all of its capabilities, but so far I have not been lost in tech-speak. I was slightly surprised how fast it burned thru batteries, so I'm with-holding judgement in that area for now just incase it was simply a poor batch of batteries that I got ahold of. I was very impressed with the audio recording capabilities, it had a nice range. The price is fair. I have not found anything that it advertises to be to be anything less then as stated.
customer_reviews.author: C.PHX

customer_reviews.title: Love to pull this out when I'm in a hurry
customer_reviews.text: Love to pull this out when I'm in a hurry. Not as good as my Nikon DSLR but terrific in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Dan McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price and superb replacement for my SX130 IS 12 MP:
customer_reviews.author: RenoDeano

customer_reviews.title: My iPhone Se is great for quick shots but this is a real camera/ ...
customer_reviews.text: My iPhone Se is great for quick shots but this is a real camera/ The 12x zoom is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Old Troll X

customer_reviews.title: and it was a good quality and has some high end features
customer_reviews.text: i got this for one of my friends. and it was a good quality and has some high end features.
customer_reviews.author: Mindika Dharmabandu

customer_reviews.title: I returned this camera disappointed, however returning not difficult
customer_reviews.text: This camera ate batteries especially when using the zoom/flash. Photos were washed out even though taken on a clear day. I returned this camera disappointed, however returning not difficult.Researching cameras on Amazon for another.
customer_reviews.author: J R H Reader

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love my camera. The only thing I am disappointed in is that it takes a while to snap pictures sometimes. The flash takes a while to recharge. I have missed several good shots because of this
customer_reviews.author: Xjerzgirl

customer_reviews.title: Worked great...until it broke
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with this camera. Great zoom, features, etc. It really worked great. But after about 4 months of owning it, it suddenly just shut down, saying it needed new batteries. When I replaced the batteries, it still said it needed new batteries. I'm in the process of sending the camera into Canon for repair since it's still under the limited warranty, so we'll have to see how it works once I get it back. So far, however, I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ktsreviews

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Its a good size camera..takes nice pics but you have to keep your hand still or it blurs easily.
customer_reviews.author: Guard Dog

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: An amazing camera for the price. Everything works perfectly. Everything comes out super clear. So glad I bought this. I would highly recommend this to anyone needing a camera that could pass as professional quality for a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great zoom in a small camera.
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and compact camera that fits easily in my jacket pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Margelofsky

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. I thought just because it was a version newer than my friend that maybe it would be a better camera but that was not the case. It didn't have the motion detection on it; I so wanted that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfieddiva

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SX150
customer_reviews.text: This was the first digital camera that I've owned, it was very easy to understand. The pictures all came out good, very clear. When downloading them on my computer the instructions were easy to follow and even a nerd like me had no problems at all. I would recomend this camera to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: A great product except for two things
customer_reviews.text: This camera has many terrific lighting features from fireworks to ultraviolet. The pictures are clear and well defined. One of my irritations is the play button is next to the video button which should NEVER BE. I end up pushing the video button accidentally because I'm all thumbs! The other irritation is the flash will not automatically pop up when needed. Compared to Powershot A710, this model is lighter in weight.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Hockenberry

customer_reviews.title: great pictures. The best gift to initiate a kid ...
customer_reviews.text: A little camera, great pictures. The best gift to initiate a kid learning photography with few dollars. Now and day you get newer versions, all of them with the same quality: SX 160, SX170...
customer_reviews.author: ÓSCAR ÁGREDO PIEDRAHÍTA - COLOMBIA

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I use rechargeable batteries and I can't find a charger pack for the camera. so I charge them seperately.That's my only complaint otherwise it takes really good pic's and the zoom if terriffic.
customer_reviews.author: jimmon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent detail, color and price.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic results! Sunflower photo could not be rivaled by my DSLR cameras! Stabilizer and detail above expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Spot on as a replacement of one that I carelessly lost.
customer_reviews.author: Geogeo

customer_reviews.title: I'm so happy with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera here in Amazon, because I read the feedback about this product and I liked the things people say about it. I'm very happy with this purchase because I think you can not find a digital camera better than this one at such a great price. What I like the most about this camera, is that you can take your pics using a few other options in addition to the fully automatic mode; just as the very expensive cameras can do it, so that you can control the camera to do what you want it to do. This was a great buy and I recommend this product to everybody!
customer_reviews.author: E. F. Robaina

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide-Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD (Black) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Discover how simple and easy it is to be creative and shoot memorable photos and videos of your favorite subjects with the PowerShot SX150 IS digital camera. Its compact size makes it convenient to carry around everywhere to capture those special moments that can happen anytime! Sporting a stylish design, it comes in two great colors: Black and Red. 14.1 Megapixels deliver stunning image detail and enable you to make beautiful large prints. 12x Optical Zoom lets you get close to distant subjects, while the 28mm wide-angle capability makes this camera great for photographing large groups of people and scenic landscapes. Advanced technologies, such as Intelligent IS and Smart AUTO, make it easy and effortless to capture gorgeous still images and HD video. It all makes the PowerShot SX150 IS the perfect camera to capture the good times, wherever you might be.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Memory-Making Made Easy

Discover how simple and easy it is to be creative and shoot memorable photos and videos of your favorite subjects with the PowerShot SX150 IS digital camera. Its compact size makes it convenient to carry around everywhere to capture those special moments that can happen anytime! Sporting a stylish design, it comes in two great colors: Black and Red. 14.1 Megapixels deliver stunning image detail and enable you to make beautiful large prints. 12x Optical Zoom lets you get close to distant subjects, while the 28mm wide-angle capability makes this camera great for photographing large groups of people and scenic landscapes. Advanced technologies, such as Intelligent IS and Smart AUTO, make it easy and effortless to capture gorgeous still images and HD video. It all makes the PowerShot SX150 IS the perfect camera to capture the good times, wherever you might be.

Precision Canon Optics

12x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle Lens
The PowerShot SX150 IS features a powerful Genuine Canon 12x Zoom Lens that delivers outstanding optical performance and versatility. With precision engineering and decades of leadership in optical technologies, Canon has created a bright, wide-angle lens that provides an extraordinary 12x zoom range. The lens starts at 28mm wide-angle and extends to 336mm telephoto (35mm equivalent), giving you tremendous coverage and reach. The telephoto end lets you capture subjects from a considerable distance, while the 28mm wide-angle makes it easy to shoot sweeping landscapes, large groups of people and tall buildings. Moreover, this superlative lens incorporates innovative designs that enable it to fit the compact profile of the PowerShot SX150 IS and perform at high speed with low power consumption.


Optical Image Stabilizer
Handheld shooting can often lead to camera shake, making photos and videos blurry. Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer is a sophisticated system that uses lens-shift technology to correct for unwanted camera movement. It makes handheld photography more practical in more shooting situations, providing excellent image quality in many difficult situations: outdoors at dusk, inside without a flash, and even at the telephoto end of the zoom range without a tripod. For still photos, it enables shooting at slower shutter speeds, accommodating more low-light shooting situations than ever before without having to boost ISO sensitivity. With camera shake and vibration reduced, you get a sharper, steadier image. And because it is an optical system, there is none of the image degradation typical with electronic image stabilizers.


Powerful Performance for Better Images

14.1 Megapixel Sensor
A 14.1 Megapixel sensor delivers beautiful photos with fine detail and brilliant color. The high resolution ensures superb image quality even when cropping or making very large prints.

Canon DIGIC 4 Image Processor
Canon DIGIC Image Processors have set the standard for functionality and performance since their groundbreaking introduction in 1999. With each successive generation, DIGIC processors have brought elevated performance and powerful new features to PowerShot digital cameras. The DIGIC 4 processor has ushered in a new level of picture quality and accelerated processing, making possible features such as high-speed continuous shooting, Full HD video and Face Detection Self-timer. New, more powerful noise reduction algorithms also provide improved low-light capture.


A Smarter Camera Means Better Photos and Videos

Smart AUTO
The PowerShot SX150 IS features Smart AUTO – sophisticated Canon technology that makes getting that great shot as simple as pressing the shutter button. Smart AUTO automatically detects scenes by assessing various factors in both the background and the subject. Detected scenes are analyzed using 32 predefined shooting situations. The camera then makes optimal settings to ensure the best possible image capture, whether you’re shooting stills or video. Smart AUTO also includes Advanced Subject Detection, which allows the camera to detect and track non-human moving subjects like animals and vehicles. With Smart AUTO, all you have to do is frame your shot and capture away.


Shooting Modes/Special Scene Modes


Smart AUTO
The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity.
Kids & Pets Reduced focusing time freezes fast-moving subjects, so you won't miss those special shots. Portrait 
The camera sets a large aperture, focusing the subject and artistically blurring the background to make your subject “pop.”
Manual 
You have complete contrl of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually. 
Low Light For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly-lit situations.
Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect.
Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts.
Beach Beach Get clear shots of people at a sunny beach without darkened faces.
Fireworks Grab brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks.
Aperture-Priority 
You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed. 
Program Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically.
Fisheye Effect Add a classic photo distortion without a fisheye lens.
Shutter-priority You select the shutter speed to stop or blur action, and the camera finds the appropriate aperture. With slow exposure times, Canon's noise reduction system activates to ensure low image noise.
Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue.
Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome.
Foliage Capture brilliant shots of autumn foliage, greenery and blossoms.
Landscape Increases depth-of-field for sharp and sweeping landscape shots. 
Movie Digest Records a video clip before capturing a still image and then combines one day’s worth of clips into a video.
Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame.
Discreet Mode Disables flash, AF assist beam, and all camera sounds with one mode dial setting — so you can capture images in quiet areas.
Miniature Effect for Movies & Stills Emphasizes perspectives for a miniature effect by blurring upper and bottom portions of the image.
Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors.

Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects.
Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint.
iFrame Movie The Apple® movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality.
Movie 
Record video in stereo sound. Unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. Easy Mode 
In Easy mode, shooting is simple and relaxed—the camera handles all the settings automatically.


Turn Any Moment into an HD Video Memory

Canon HD Video Advantage
The PowerShot SX150 IS lets you record spectacularly detailed 720p HD video at 30* frames per second with clear stereo sound. Imagine the fun and excitement of being able to shoot high definition video whenever you want, then downloading the videos to your computer to watch or share with family and friends. 
*Actual frame rate is 29.97 fps.

Dedicated Movie Button, Wind Filter and Optical Zoom While Shooting
It’s never been easier to shoot videos with a PowerShot digital camera. The PowerShot SX150 IS has a dedicated movie button that lets you start and stop recording instantly. There is no need to go through layers of menus or operate switches or dials to switch to and from video recording mode. The camera is always ready to shoot stills or video whenever you want. The PowerShot SX150 IS also incorporates an electronic wind filter, which suppresses wind noise that can muffle or distort the sound. And unlike less sophisticated point-and-shoot cameras, the PowerShot SX150 IS lets you use the full 12x range of optical zoom when you’re shooting a video without sacrificing HD video resolution.

iFrame Movie Support
With the PowerShot SX150 IS, you can also shoot video in the Apple iFrame format, which is a computer-friendly standard that speeds up importing and editing of videos. It keeps file sizes small, making it more convenient to upload or e-mail high-quality videos. The iFrame format enjoys native support in compatible Mac and Windows video applications, making it unnecessary to perform time-consuming and often quality-degrading conversions.


A Steady Image Is a Beautiful Image

Intelligent IS
The latest advance in Canon Optical Image Stabilization technology, Intelligent IS analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes. With Intelligent IS, you can concentrate on image capture, letting the camera make the most effective IS settings to assure the steadiest possible image. 

Normal
Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning
Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Hybrid
Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic
Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered
Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod
When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. 

See the Image in a Big Screen

Large 3.0-inch LCD
The camera's high-resolution (230,000 dots) 3.0-inch LCD gives you the big picture, whether you're shooting, reviewing or showing off your images. This high-resolution screen offers a crisp, clear picture to make shooting, playback and using the camera's menu functions especially convenient. Clear and bright, it also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light.


Power on the Go

AA Battery Powered
Recharging batteries can often be an inconvenience, especially when traveling in foreign countries. With the PowerShot SX150 IS, you’ll never need special power adapters or chargers because it’s powered by two AA batteries that are widely available around the world. 


Easier, More Enjoyable Photography

Face Detection Technology
Special Scene Modes
Best Image Selection

What’s in the Box
• PowerShot SX150 IS Body
• 2 AA-size Alkaline Batteries 
• Wrist Strap WS-800
• USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU
• Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM
